conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you with storing dal to reduce waste.

• Store cooked dal in an airtight container in the refrigerator. It will last for 3-4 days.

• For longer storage, freeze cooked dal in portions. It can last for up to 2 months.

• Dry dal should be stored in an airtight container in a cool, dark, and dry place. It can last for up to 1 year.

• Consider making dal paratha (approx. 40 BDT) from leftover dal to prevent waste.

Reducing food waste helps lower greenhouse gas emissions in Bangladesh.

Next step: Check your dal storage and ensure it's properly sealed.

Hello! I can definitely guide you on vegetables rich in vitamins.

• Focus on vegetables that are dark green, red, and orange, as they are usually packed with vitamins.

• Carrots (approx. 20 BDT per kg) are a good source of Vitamin A.

• Spinach (approx. 30 BDT per kg) provides plenty of Vitamin K and other essential nutrients.

Getting enough vitamins is crucial for overall health and energy.

Next step: Consider adding carrots or spinach to your next meal.

Hello! I can help you create a meal plan for 500 BDT.

• Main suggestion: Chicken and vegetable curry with rice (approx. 250 BDT). Provides protein and essential vitamins.

• Cheaper alternative: Egg and potato curry with dal and rice (approx. 180 BDT).

Shopping tip: Buy seasonal vegetables from local markets for better prices.
Next step: Plan your meals for the week using these suggestions.
